Description: Body sherd of Attic red-figured pottery calyx-krater; interior glazed black; exterior: added white band at top of sherd; below, red-figure decoration consisting of female figure to left (upper body with added white flesh, white wreath, traces of dilute brown lines for eyebrow and eye, necklace and drapery), holding up a white object probably a mirror possibly in her right hand; part of undetermined motif, overlaps her left shoulder, probably red-figure drapery.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0188) (Phase 1)
